alert.note: Alert for Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 12:44AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wood County through 115 AM CDT... At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Babcock, or 13 miles southwest of Wisconsin Rapids, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Wood County, including the following locations... Sandhill Wildlife Area, Walker, Dexterville, Cranmoor, Nekoosa and Port Edwards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
